sentence.idiomatic: That guy up ahead looks so familiar. I feel like I've seen him somewhere before.
Your mobile phone is identical to his. No wonder it looks so familiar.
How come the beautiful girl in the photo looks so familiar--it isn't you, is it?

word.literal: to seem as if have met before

sentence.idiomatic: When I saw her I got the feeling we had met somewhere before.

word.literal: to seem as if have met before

sentence.idiomatic: Just as he turned his head, I suddenly got a strong feeling that I had met him somewhere before.

word.literal: to seem as if have seen before

sentence.idiomatic: I have obviously never been here before, how come it feels like I've seen it before?
You're just looking to make the same old excuses, it's getting really old.
Your methods for picking up girls are really outdated, no wonder people aren't attracted to you.
What era are we in now already--how can your thinking be so archaic?
Having such a thick necklace hanging around your neck--it's so tacky!
Red and green worn together looks a bit tacky.
This kind of girl is so vulgar--all she thinks about is money.
Wow! That woman has so much style.
Only black can go with her elegant style.
I was won over by the unique way she has about her.
That we could meet in such a strange place--it must be fate.
You are really bound by fate. No matter where you go you will run into each other.
Love has to do with fate. I don't want to specifically go looking for it.
You invite people to eat and you arrive late. Don't you think that's very insincere?
If you want me to believe you, then you'll have to prove your sincerity.
The other party isn't sincere enough, so we don't plan to work together with them.
Hey, miss, I think we have met somewhere before.
Really?
I think you look really familiar.
I don't think so.
Let me think a moment. No, we have definitely met before. Otherwise, why would I have this feeling that I know you?
Please... what decade are you from? You are using such old lines. How tacky!
Ouch, she sure has a mouth on her. Miss, you like to drink beer? You should be drinking champagne.
Why?
I think for you, only champagne would be sophisticated enough.
Whatever.
Man! Why am I having such bad luck today? Miss, may I take a seat next to you?
Feel free.
You know... I have never been to this bar before. But, I'm glad I did.
Why?
Because I met you, it's fate. Don't you think?
You say that to all the girls.
No, I've only said this to you. We... can we be friends?
That depends on if you are sincere or not!
Sincerity doesn't come from the mouth. As long as you give me the time, you will certainly see.

word.literal: to feel as though have seen before
the way a person has about them
destined to meet but not to end up together
